channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024111050
item.description:
Report X-2024111050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-30T12:29:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-23
  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Report from yard crew of possible release to top and sides of tank car TILX 135353 in Altoona, WI yard. Inspection by UPRR Hazmat Dept and Rybak Environmental, contractor, found all 8 manway swing bolts less than tool tight. Release was to the top and sides of car only. Manway nozzle and outside car surface cleaned and manway swing bolts properly secured.

item.title: Report E-2024110482
item.description:
Report E-2024110482

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approx 2 quart release impacting the trailer floor, concrete dock, and wooden pallet. The crew utilized oil dri to clean the release and soda ash to neutralize the impacted areas. No Drains, Soils or Waterways were reported impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024110488
item.description:
Report E-2024110488

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: DARIEN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4111
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was attempting to deliver diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. There was a cover that was not tightly secured that leaked approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel. Hazchem Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024110823
item.description:
Report X-2024110823

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: WEST ALLIS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated they are unsure how the pail was damaged but seems to be punctured. The forklift operator did not say that he punctured the drum. ABF operator was moving the freight around and noticed the pail was leaking causing roughly 2-3 cups to spill onto the freight itself and a bit onto the dock. ABF placed the pail into a bucket and placed oil dry on the spill.
